page.title: 08TOURISM IN MALVERN WELLS i
page.content: Although a spa 100 years before Great Malvern, Malvern Wells was much smaller. The{Holy Well}still attracts visitors although it no longer has a mineral water bottling plant. Several large houses on the Wells Road notably Thornbank and May Place date from the early{Water Cure}but are now flats. Hotels include the{Cottage in the Wood with a high reputation for its cuisine, the{Essington,}the{Malvern {Hills Hotel}at British Camp and {Holdfast Cottage.}Numerous houses and farms offer{bed and breakfast}in the summer. Licensed restaurants include the{Croque en Bouche}nationally renowned for its wine list. The 3 Counties Showground offers{camping and {caravan facilities}on a year-round basis - for the 3 days of the agricultural show in June marquees providing many amenities spring up.
